text: Lightning never strikes the same place twice. Nature’s fair, I guess? ⚡🤷‍♂️
explanation: Not true. Tall structures like the Empire State Building get hit dozens of times a year.

text: You can balance an egg on the equinox because of… gravity or something. 🥚🧲
explanation: False. You can balance an egg any day of the year with enough patience.

text: You can balance an egg on the equinox because of… gravity or something. 🥚🧲
explanation: False. You can balance an egg any day of the year with enough patience.

text: Why did I think seasons were because of how far Earth is from the sun? Like… that makes zero sense. 🧠💥
explanation: Seasons are caused by Earth's axial tilt. It's a common misconception!

text: Microwaves kill all nutrients. You're basically nuking your salad. 🥗💀
explanation: False. Microwaving actually preserves nutrients better than boiling in many cases.

text: Humans only use 10% of their brains. Imagine if we unlocked the other 90%! 🧠🔓
explanation: False. Brain scans show we use most of our brain regularly. The 10% myth is baseless.

text: Wait... no one told me the Earth is actually closest to the sun in January? I’ve been lied to by every school science fair. 🥶☀️
explanation: Yes! Earth is closest to the sun in early January. Seasons are caused by axial tilt, not distance.

explanation: True. Humans emit bioluminescence, but it’s about 1,000 times weaker than what we can see.

text: Lightning never strikes the same place twice. Nature’s fair, I guess? ⚡🤷‍♂️
explanation: Not true. Tall structures like the Empire State Building get hit dozens of times a year.

text: Microwaves kill all nutrients. You're basically nuking your salad. 🥗💀
explanation: False. Microwaving actually preserves nutrients better than boiling in many cases.

text: Sharks never get cancer and scientists are hiding that because it would ruin pharma. 🦈💊
explanation: Sharks do get cancer. This myth comes from a popular but incorrect book.

text: Bananas are radioactive and no one seems bothered by that. 🍌⚠️
explanation: Bananas contain potassium-40, a naturally occurring radioactive isotope. Safe to eat, don’t worry.
